markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Giant Flytrap](/Monsters.aspx?ID=209)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Because they blend in so well with surrounding foliage, giant flytraps can use the element of surprise to make quick strikes against unsuspecting adventurers and forest travelers.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 27

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 25

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Flytrap_GiantFlytrap.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 10">[Giant Flytrap](/Monsters.aspx?ID=209)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Mindless" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=108" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 160</row>

**Perception** +17; tremorsense (imprecise) 60 feet

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +23, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +21

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +5

**Con** +5

**Int** -5

**Wis** +3

**Cha** -2
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 29 

**Fort** +21 

**Ref** +17 

**Will** +15 

</row>

**HP** 185

**Immunities**
mental

**Resistances**
acid 10

**Weaknesses**
fire 10

**Quick Capture** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature hits or touches the flytrap. **Effect** The flytrap makes a leaf Strike against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is grabbed in that leaf.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
leaf +23 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+7 piercing plus 2d6 acid and Improved Grab

**Focused Assault** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The flytrap attacks a single target with all four of its leaves. The flytrap makes one leaf Strike. On a success, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf Strike plus an additional 1d8 damage for every leaf beyond the first. On a failure, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf Strike, but it can’t use Improved Grab. It deals no damage on a critical failure. This counts toward the flytrap’s multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of leaves the flytrap has.

**Hungry Flurry** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The flytrap makes four leaf Strikes at a –2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the flytrap’s multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes all its attacks.

**[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Large, 2d8+3 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid, Rupture 17

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png">Flytrap Treasure</title>

Giant flytraps have enough instinctual intellect to effectively ambush prey or to move about to seek out better hunting grounds, but they don’t value treasure. Still, a flytrap tends to accumulate a small wealth of discarded loot from those it has eaten, discarding these shiny baubles in the periphery of its root system once it has finished digesting its meal.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-48" />
name: Giant Flytrap
